title.narrative: Mainstreaming Green growth in Development Planning

description.narrative: Support the government in ensuring that green growth is incorporated into national, regional and provincial development planning. Facilitate the improvement of development guidelines for adoption and the development of a replication plan in order to scale up the use of the guidelines.

The Philippines’ decentralized governance structure and cyclical changes in Government Administrations – six years for national government and three years for local government- have impacted the continuity of government plans and projects. Recognizing these institutional constraints, NEDA, the lead socio-economic planning agency of the Philippines, has developed a National Long-Term Vision (NLTV) to give continuity to government programs across ensuing administrations. The NLTV embodies the aspirations of the Filipino people and provides the basic framework in the formulation of national, sectoral and local development plans, such as the Philippine Development Plan. The NLTV serves as a strategic platform to introduce new approaches in national development planning. However, a critical gap remains in the operationalization of the NLTV, particularly in its ability to be cascaded with appropriate climate goals and adopted by the Local Government Units to eventually influence the formulation of their respective local development plans. Strengthening the national, regional and local government planning nexus, and harmonizing the sectoral and thematic planning, strategies and targets through the use of a green growth lens would be a critical element in ensuring that SDG targets are achieved as envisioned by the NLTV, and inclusive growth and climate resilience are promoted.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04548 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "Mainstreaming Green Growth in Development Planning" - Project Results Report
Green Growth approaches institutionalized in pursuing government development targets
At least 50% of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) targets achieved by 2030
Guidelines for mainstreaming green growth tools in planning adopted as reference in government development planning

description.narrative: NEDA, as the key government partner has welcomed the project results - the adoption for reference in local development planning the Green Growth Planning Toolkit for Development Planning. NEDA has requested the support for the scaling up and wider application of the Green Growth Planning Toolkit.

title.narrative: Government communication acknowledging green growth principles, tools and techniques in the overall and respective planning processes
National and Local Development Plans enhanced using green growth planning guidelines and tools

description.narrative: Recommendations on integrating green growth to the target local development plans were discussed, reviewed and validated with the project stakeholders and respective pilot agencies, and then submitted to the Government partner, NEDA, the DTI-BSMED as pilot NGA, and to the LGUs Bataan and Dinagat Islands as our pilot LGUs.

title.narrative: Recommendations on integrating green growth into 2 LGUs and 1 NGA development plans (based on use of the GG Toolkit) submitted to LGUs/NGAs/NEDA
Green Growth Planning Guidelines and Toolkit Drafted for Piloting

description.narrative: The Green Growth Planning Toolkit contains both tools and techniques and is developed in two volumes: - Volume 1: Operational Guide- is a step-by-step guide to integrating green growth within the Philippine development planning context and anchored on the Philippine Government’s Provincial/Local Planning and Expenditure Management Guidelines; and - Volume 2: Resource Note - features the green growth concept and model; explores how green growth evolved and how it operationalizes sustainable development; andshowcases some global and local good practices, particularly relevant to green growth and energy, tourism and MSMED promotion.

title.narrative: One (1) set of Green Growth Tools and Techniques developed and submitted to NEDA
Training for Partners and Key Stakeholders on the Green Growth Tools Conducted

description.narrative: To pilot-test the Green Growth Planning Toolkit, training modules for mainstreaming green growth in development planning were designed and training workshops were delivered in the pilot LGUs, Bataan and Dinagat Islands, and in the pilot NGA, the DTI-BSMED. For LGU Bataan, the module implementation was divided into 5 training workshops for the targeted TWG-member offices including the representatives of the 10 out of 11 Municipal LGUs of Bataan Province; for LGU Dinagat Islands, the module was implemented into 3 training workshops including representatives of the 7 Municipal LGUs of the Dinagat Islands Province as part of the TWG, and for DTI-BSMED, one national and 3 local workshops were conducted to implement the training module on mainstreaming green growth in the MSMED Local Action Planning.

title.narrative: One (1) training event on green growth planning delivered to NGA and LGUs
